cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi (70 km) NW of Ciudad del Carmen, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast Thursday, then move generally north through the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana vicinity) this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near the Mississippi River delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for the U.S. coast (only Mexico under a Tropical Storm Warning at this time)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from the Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama likely to experience impacts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≈7%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25–35 mph late weekend if the storm tracks far enough west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks closer to the TX-LA border, minor surge of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Sabine Pass and lower Sabine–Neches waterway.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts Sunday–Monday, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged onshore flow may slow vessel movements in the Sabine Pass channel; elevated river levels and possible mud-slides on upland terminal access roads.
